meanings.definition: To give a new form or meaning to.
meanings.sent1: The designer recoins the old dress into a trendy outfit.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often recoin traditional lessons to engage students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian recoins a classic joke with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: His words recoin the conversation into a deep discussion.
meanings.sent5: The artist recoins the sculpture, transforming it into a masterpiece.
